title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 4118/87 of 21 December 1987 fixing the amount of the carry-over premium for certain fishery products for the 1988 fishing year
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 4118/87
of 21 December 1987
fixing the amount of the carry-over premium for certain fishery products for the 1988 fishing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: For the 1988 fishing year, the carry-over premium for the products listed in Annex I to Regulation (EEC) No 2203/82 shall be as indicated in the Annex.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 January 1988.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.

(1) Given that the amount of the premium may not in particular exceed 50 % of Community withdrawal price for the fresh product (Article 14 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 3796/81), this amount shall be reduced:
(a) for the Atlantic sardines:
- to 67 ECU/tonne in the coastal areas of and islands of the counties of Cornwall and Devon in the United Kingdom,
- to 83 ECU/tonne in Spain and Portugal;
(b) for the anchovies to 95 ECU/tonne in all Member States other than Spain.
